Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the scope of the Arizona immigration law by stating that "any police officer can stop anyone who appears to them to be reasonably suspicious of being an undocumented person." It is unclear if the law explicitly states this or if it allows for more nuanced criteria for reasonable suspicion.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Arizona immigration law will lead to rampant racial profiling. This assumption may not be supported by evidence or may oversimplify the complex factors that contribute to racial profiling.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide specific evidence or sources to support its assertion about the Arizona immigration law. It would benefit from including more information or references to back up its claim.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or interpretations of the Arizona immigration law. It presents a one-sided view without acknowledging potential counterarguments or different perspectives.
